 157: ## =============================================================================
 158: ## PriorityHeap data structure
 159: ## =============================================================================
 160: #
 161: #cdef class PriorityHeap:
 162: #    """A priority queue implemented as a binary heap.
 163: #    The heap invariant is that the impurity improvement of the parent record
 164: #    is larger then the impurity improvement of the children.
 165: #    Attributes
 166: #    ----------
 167: #    capacity : SIZE_t
 168: #        The capacity of the heap
 169: #    heap_ptr : SIZE_t
 170: #        The water mark of the heap; the heap grows from left to right in the
 171: #        array ``heap_``. The following invariant holds ``heap_ptr < capacity``.
 172: #    heap_ : PriorityHeapRecord*
 173: #        The array of heap records. The maximum element is on the left;
 174: #        the heap grows from left to right
 175: #    """
 176: #
 177: #    def __cinit__(self, SIZE_t capacity):
 178: #        self.capacity = capacity
 179: #        self.heap_ptr = 0
 180: #        safe_realloc(&self.heap_, capacity)
 181: #
 182: #    def __dealloc__(self):
 183: #        free(self.heap_)
 184: #
 185: #    cdef bint is_empty(self) nogil:
 186: #        return self.heap_ptr <= 0
 187: #
 188: #    cdef void heapify_up(self, PriorityHeapRecord* heap, SIZE_t pos) nogil:
 189: #        """Restore heap invariant parent.improvement > child.improvement from
 190: #           ``pos`` upwards. """
 191: #        if pos == 0:
 192: #            return
 193: #
 194: #        cdef SIZE_t parent_pos = (pos - 1) / 2
 195: #
 196: #        if heap[parent_pos].improvement < heap[pos].improvement:
 197: #            heap[parent_pos], heap[pos] = heap[pos], heap[parent_pos]
 198: #            self.heapify_up(heap, parent_pos)
 199: #
 200: #    cdef void heapify_down(self, PriorityHeapRecord* heap, SIZE_t pos,
 201: #                           SIZE_t heap_length) nogil:
 202: #        """Restore heap invariant parent.improvement > children.improvement from
 203: #           ``pos`` downwards. """
 204: #        cdef SIZE_t left_pos = 2 * (pos + 1) - 1
 205: #        cdef SIZE_t right_pos = 2 * (pos + 1)
 206: #        cdef SIZE_t largest = pos
 207: #
 208: #        if (left_pos < heap_length and
 209: #                heap[left_pos].improvement > heap[largest].improvement):
 210: #            largest = left_pos
 211: #
 212: #        if (right_pos < heap_length and
 213: #                heap[right_pos].improvement > heap[largest].improvement):
 214: #            largest = right_pos
 215: #
 216: #        if largest != pos:
 217: #            heap[pos], heap[largest] = heap[largest], heap[pos]
 218: #            self.heapify_down(heap, largest, heap_length)
 219: #
 220: #    cdef int push(self, SIZE_t node_id, SIZE_t start, SIZE_t end, SIZE_t pos,
 221: #                  SIZE_t depth, bint is_leaf, double improvement,
 222: #                  double impurity, double impurity_left,
 223: #                  double impurity_right) nogil except -1:
 224: #        """Push record on the priority heap.
 225: #        Return -1 in case of failure to allocate memory (and raise MemoryError)
 226: #        or 0 otherwise.
 227: #        """
 228: #        cdef SIZE_t heap_ptr = self.heap_ptr
 229: #        cdef PriorityHeapRecord* heap = NULL
 230: #
 231: #        # Resize if capacity not sufficient
 232: #        if heap_ptr >= self.capacity:
 233: #            self.capacity *= 2
 234: #            # Since safe_realloc can raise MemoryError, use `except -1`
 235: #            safe_realloc(&self.heap_, self.capacity)
 236: #
 237: #        # Put element as last element of heap
 238: #        heap = self.heap_
 239: #        heap[heap_ptr].node_id = node_id
 240: #        heap[heap_ptr].start = start
 241: #        heap[heap_ptr].end = end
 242: #        heap[heap_ptr].pos = pos
 243: #        heap[heap_ptr].depth = depth
 244: #        heap[heap_ptr].is_leaf = is_leaf
 245: #        heap[heap_ptr].impurity = impurity
 246: #        heap[heap_ptr].impurity_left = impurity_left
 247: #        heap[heap_ptr].impurity_right = impurity_right
 248: #        heap[heap_ptr].improvement = improvement
 249: #
 250: #        # Heapify up
 251: #        self.heapify_up(heap, heap_ptr)
 252: #
 253: #        # Increase element count
 254: #        self.heap_ptr = heap_ptr + 1
 255: #        return 0
 256: #
 257: #    cdef int pop(self, PriorityHeapRecord* res) nogil:
 258: #        """Remove max element from the heap. """
 259: #        cdef SIZE_t heap_ptr = self.heap_ptr
 260: #        cdef PriorityHeapRecord* heap = self.heap_
 261: #
 262: #        if heap_ptr <= 0:
 263: #            return -1
 264: #
 265: #        # Take first element
 266: #        res[0] = heap[0]
 267: #
 268: #        # Put last element to the front
 269: #        heap[0], heap[heap_ptr - 1] = heap[heap_ptr - 1], heap[0]
 270: #
 271: #        # Restore heap invariant
 272: #        if heap_ptr > 1:
 273: #            self.heapify_down(heap, 0, heap_ptr - 1)
 274: #
 275: #        self.heap_ptr = heap_ptr - 1
 276: #
 277: #        return 0
 278: #
 279: ## =============================================================================
 280: ## WeightedPQueue data structure
 281: ## =============================================================================
 282: #
 283: #cdef class WeightedPQueue:
 284: #    """A priority queue class, always sorted in increasing order.
 285: #    Attributes
 286: #    ----------
 287: #    capacity : SIZE_t
 288: #        The capacity of the priority queue.
 289: #    array_ptr : SIZE_t
 290: #        The water mark of the priority queue; the priority queue grows from
 291: #        left to right in the array ``array_``. ``array_ptr`` is always
 292: #        less than ``capacity``.
 293: #    array_ : WeightedPQueueRecord*
 294: #        The array of priority queue records. The minimum element is on the
 295: #        left at index 0, and the maximum element is on the right at index
 296: #        ``array_ptr-1``.
 297: #    """
 298: #
 299: #    def __cinit__(self, SIZE_t capacity):
 300: #        self.capacity = capacity
 301: #        self.array_ptr = 0
 302: #        safe_realloc(&self.array_, capacity)
 303: #
 304: #    def __dealloc__(self):
 305: #        free(self.array_)
 306: #
 307: #    cdef int reset(self) nogil except -1:
 308: #        """Reset the WeightedPQueue to its state at construction
 309: #        Return -1 in case of failure to allocate memory (and raise MemoryError)
 310: #        or 0 otherwise.
 311: #        """
 312: #        self.array_ptr = 0
 313: #        # Since safe_realloc can raise MemoryError, use `except *`
 314: #        safe_realloc(&self.array_, self.capacity)
 315: #        return 0
 316: #
 317: #    cdef bint is_empty(self) nogil:
 318: #        return self.array_ptr <= 0
 319: #
 320: #    cdef SIZE_t size(self) nogil:
 321: #        return self.array_ptr
 322: #
 323: #    cdef int push(self, DOUBLE_t data, DOUBLE_t weight) nogil except -1:
 324: #        """Push record on the array.
 325: #        Return -1 in case of failure to allocate memory (and raise MemoryError)
 326: #        or 0 otherwise.
 327: #        """
 328: #        cdef SIZE_t array_ptr = self.array_ptr
 329: #        cdef WeightedPQueueRecord* array = NULL
 330: #        cdef SIZE_t i
 331: #
 332: #        # Resize if capacity not sufficient
 333: #        if array_ptr >= self.capacity:
 334: #            self.capacity *= 2
 335: #            # Since safe_realloc can raise MemoryError, use `except -1`
 336: #            safe_realloc(&self.array_, self.capacity)
 337: #
 338: #        # Put element as last element of array
 339: #        array = self.array_
 340: #        array[array_ptr].data = data
 341: #        array[array_ptr].weight = weight
 342: #
 343: #        # bubble last element up according until it is sorted
 344: #        # in ascending order
 345: #        i = array_ptr
 346: #        while(i != 0 and array[i].data < array[i-1].data):
 347: #            array[i], array[i-1] = array[i-1], array[i]
 348: #            i -= 1
 349: #
 350: #        # Increase element count
 351: #        self.array_ptr = array_ptr + 1
 352: #        return 0
 353: #
 354: #    cdef int remove(self, DOUBLE_t data, DOUBLE_t weight) nogil:
 355: #        """Remove a specific value/weight record from the array.
 356: #        Returns 0 if successful, -1 if record not found."""
 357: #        cdef SIZE_t array_ptr = self.array_ptr
 358: #        cdef WeightedPQueueRecord* array = self.array_
 359: #        cdef SIZE_t idx_to_remove = -1
 360: #        cdef SIZE_t i
 361: #
 362: #        if array_ptr <= 0:
 363: #            return -1
 364: #
 365: #        # find element to remove
 366: #        for i in range(array_ptr):
 367: #            if array[i].data == data and array[i].weight == weight:
 368: #                idx_to_remove = i
 369: #                break
 370: #
 371: #        if idx_to_remove == -1:
 372: #            return -1
 373: #
 374: #        # shift the elements after the removed element
 375: #        # to the left.
 376: #        for i in range(idx_to_remove, array_ptr-1):
 377: #            array[i] = array[i+1]
 378: #
 379: #        self.array_ptr = array_ptr - 1
 380: #        return 0
 381: #
 382: #    cdef int pop(self, DOUBLE_t* data, DOUBLE_t* weight) nogil:
 383: #        """Remove the top (minimum) element from array.
 384: #        Returns 0 if successful, -1 if nothing to remove."""
 385: #        cdef SIZE_t array_ptr = self.array_ptr
 386: #        cdef WeightedPQueueRecord* array = self.array_
 387: #        cdef SIZE_t i
 388: #
 389: #        if array_ptr <= 0:
 390: #            return -1
 391: #
 392: #        data[0] = array[0].data
 393: #        weight[0] = array[0].weight

 396: #        # to the left.

 400: #        self.array_ptr = array_ptr - 1

 430: ## =============================================================================
 431: ## WeightedMedianCalculator data structure
 432: ## =============================================================================
 433: #
 434: #cdef class WeightedMedianCalculator:
 435: #    """A class to handle calculation of the weighted median from streams of
 436: #    data. To do so, it maintains a parameter ``k`` such that the sum of the
 437: #    weights in the range [0,k) is greater than or equal to half of the total
 438: #    weight. By minimizing the value of ``k`` that fulfills this constraint,
 439: #    calculating the median is done by either taking the value of the sample
 440: #    at index ``k-1`` of ``samples`` (samples[k-1].data) or the average of
 441: #    the samples at index ``k-1`` and ``k`` of ``samples``
 442: #    ((samples[k-1] + samples[k]) / 2).
 443: #    Attributes
 444: #    ----------
 445: #    initial_capacity : SIZE_t
 446: #        The initial capacity of the WeightedMedianCalculator.
 447: #    samples : WeightedPQueue
 448: #        Holds the samples (consisting of values and their weights) used in the
 449: #        weighted median calculation.
 450: #    total_weight : DOUBLE_t
 451: #        The sum of the weights of items in ``samples``. Represents the total
 452: #        weight of all samples used in the median calculation.
 453: #    k : SIZE_t
 454: #        Index used to calculate the median.
 455: #    sum_w_0_k : DOUBLE_t
 456: #        The sum of the weights from samples[0:k]. Used in the weighted
 457: #        median calculation; minimizing the value of ``k`` such that
 458: #        ``sum_w_0_k`` >= ``total_weight / 2`` provides a mechanism for
 459: #        calculating the median in constant time.
 460: #    """
 461: #
 462: #    def __cinit__(self, SIZE_t initial_capacity):
 463: #        self.initial_capacity = initial_capacity
 464: #        self.samples = WeightedPQueue(initial_capacity)
 465: #        self.total_weight = 0
 466: #        self.k = 0
 467: #        self.sum_w_0_k = 0
 468: #
 469: #    cdef SIZE_t size(self) nogil:
 470: #        """Return the number of samples in the
 471: #        WeightedMedianCalculator"""
 472: #        return self.samples.size()
 473: #
 474: #    cdef int reset(self) nogil except -1:
 475: #        """Reset the WeightedMedianCalculator to its state at construction
 476: #        Return -1 in case of failure to allocate memory (and raise MemoryError)
 477: #        or 0 otherwise.
 478: #        """
 479: #        # samples.reset (WeightedPQueue.reset) uses safe_realloc, hence
 480: #        # except -1
 481: #        self.samples.reset()
 482: #        self.total_weight = 0
 483: #        self.k = 0
 484: #        self.sum_w_0_k = 0
 485: #        return 0
 486: #
 487: #    cdef int push(self, DOUBLE_t data, DOUBLE_t weight) nogil except -1:
 488: #        """Push a value and its associated weight to the WeightedMedianCalculator
 489: #        Return -1 in case of failure to allocate memory (and raise MemoryError)
 490: #        or 0 otherwise.
 491: #        """
 492: #        cdef int return_value
 493: #        cdef DOUBLE_t original_median = 0.0
 494: #
 495: #        if self.size() != 0:
 496: #            original_median = self.get_median()
 497: #        # samples.push (WeightedPQueue.push) uses safe_realloc, hence except -1
 498: #        return_value = self.samples.push(data, weight)
 499: #        self.update_median_parameters_post_push(data, weight,
 500: #                                                original_median)
 501: #        return return_value
 502: #
 503: #    cdef int update_median_parameters_post_push(
 504: #            self, DOUBLE_t data, DOUBLE_t weight,
 505: #            DOUBLE_t original_median) nogil:
 506: #        """Update the parameters used in the median calculation,
 507: #        namely `k` and `sum_w_0_k` after an insertion"""
 508: #
 509: #        # trivial case of one element.
 510: #        if self.size() == 1:
 511: #            self.k = 1
 512: #            self.total_weight = weight
 513: #            self.sum_w_0_k = self.total_weight
 514: #            return 0
 515: #
 516: #        # get the original weighted median
 517: #        self.total_weight += weight
 518: #
 519: #        if data < original_median:
 520: #            # inserting below the median, so increment k and
 521: #            # then update self.sum_w_0_k accordingly by adding
 522: #            # the weight that was added.
 523: #            self.k += 1
 524: #            # update sum_w_0_k by adding the weight added
 525: #            self.sum_w_0_k += weight
 526: #
 527: #            # minimize k such that sum(W[0:k]) >= total_weight / 2
 528: #            # minimum value of k is 1
 529: #            while(self.k > 1 and ((self.sum_w_0_k -
 530: #                                   self.samples.get_weight_from_index(self.k-1))
 531: #                                  >= self.total_weight / 2.0)):
 532: #                self.k -= 1
 533: #                self.sum_w_0_k -= self.samples.get_weight_from_index(self.k)
 534: #            return 0
 535: #
 536: #        if data >= original_median:
 537: #            # inserting above or at the median
 538: #            # minimize k such that sum(W[0:k]) >= total_weight / 2
 539: #            while(self.k < self.samples.size() and
 540: #                  (self.sum_w_0_k < self.total_weight / 2.0)):
 541: #                self.k += 1
 542: #                self.sum_w_0_k += self.samples.get_weight_from_index(self.k-1)
 543: #            return 0
 544: #
 545: #    cdef int remove(self, DOUBLE_t data, DOUBLE_t weight) nogil:

 547: #        from consideration in the median calculation

 556: #        self.update_median_parameters_post_remove(data, weight,

 558: #        return return_value
 559: #
 560: #    cdef int pop(self, DOUBLE_t* data, DOUBLE_t* weight) nogil:
 561: #        """Pop a value from the MedianHeap, starting from the
 562: #        left and moving to the right.
 563: #        """
 564: #        cdef int return_value

 566: #
 567: #        if self.size() != 0:
 568: #            original_median = self.get_median()

 579: #
 580: #    cdef int update_median_parameters_post_remove(
 581: #            self, DOUBLE_t data, DOUBLE_t weight,
